contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} '''Marginal demand''' is the term in [[economics]] that refers to the change in demand for a product or service in response to a specific change in its price. Normally, as prices for goods or service rise, marginal demand falls. And conversely, as prices for goods or services fall, marginal demand rises. A product or service where price changes cause a relatively big change in marginal demand is said to have an ''elastic'' market. A product or service where price changes cause a relatively small change in marginal demand are said to have an ''inelastic'' market. ==See also== *[[Price elasticity of demand]] *[[Supply and demand]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Marginal Demand}} [[Category:Demand]] [[Category:Economics terminology]] {{Economics-stub}}
